title: How to Make Fish Cakes

steps.headline: Poach the fish in milk or water until flaky.
steps.description: Cod is a favorite choice, but salmon is preferred by some. You can also use haddock. Make sure you get rid of all the skin and bones after cooking them.

steps.headline: Boil the potatoes and peel them.
Place the fish and potatoes in a bowl and mash them together with a fork.
steps.description: They should be mixed together well.

steps.headline: Mix the eggs, parsley, onion and breadcrumbs.
steps.description: Add to the fish and potato. Add salt and pepper for flavor. Stir well.

steps.headline: Form the mixture into 8 patties, lightly forming it into rounded flat patties.
Buy a large can of salmon from the store.
Open the can and drain out the liquid.
Your delicious fish cakes are ready!

text: Fresh Fish Method Poach the fish in milk or water until flaky. Cod is a favorite choice, but salmon is preferred by some. You can also use haddock. Make sure you get rid of all the skin and bones after cooking them. Boil the potatoes and peel them.  Place the fish and potatoes in a bowl and mash them together with a fork. They should be mixed together well. Mix the eggs, parsley, onion and breadcrumbs. Add to the fish and potato. Add salt and pepper for flavor. Stir well. Form the mixture into 8 patties, lightly forming it into rounded flat patties.  Fry in butter or oil. Turn once until golden brown. Canned Salmon Method Buy a large can of salmon from the store.  Open the can and drain out the liquid.  Add egg and breadcrumbs. Stir. Form into patties and fry.  Your delicious fish cakes are ready!
